header_summary: - Brandon Black expresses gratitude for a fix and updates the specification for a feature, replacing "OP_0 as pubkey" with the taproot internal key. The proposed feature will consider the hash contents for each mode.- Ruben Somsen argues against the transmission of invalid transactions or blocks, as it assumes the availability of data and poses security risks. He disagrees with the idea of individual validators and emphasizes the potential impact of rejecting a Bitcoin block with the peg-out.- Alicexbt discusses covenants in the Bitcoin ecosystem, expressing a preference for CTV over APO. They highlight the benefits of CTV for the Lightning Network and briefly mention MASF and UASF.- Vincenzo Palazzo seeks feedback on lnprototest and encourages involvement from other implementations. A GitHub issue has been created to gather feedback.- David A. Harding questions the feasibility of certain points in a multiparty channel design paper and finds the proposal's reliance on "partial state updates" not feasible for trustless payments.- GamedevAlice discusses the concept of probability in the context of anonymity and raises important questions about the nature of attacks and the vulnerability of individuals. Further exploration and analysis in this area are needed.

recent_posts.title: BIP-119 UASF
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses Bitcoin covenant proposals, including a comparison spreadsheet and controversy surrounding them.
- The sender prefers CTV over APO for Lightning Network symmetry and highlights its benefits.
- They propose UASF as an alternative to MASF for enforcing consensus rules if positive feedback is received.

recent_posts.title: Backing up channel state with counterparties
recent_posts.summary:
- The concept of probability in the context of anonymity is discussed, acknowledging different perspectives.
- The attack on a victim starts before an open channel is established, making them vulnerable.
- Questions raised about attacks and individual vulnerability, emphasizing the importance of anonymity analysis.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains, with a fully 'blinded' server.
- In the musig2 protocol, party 1 generates private key x1, party 2 generates private key x2.
- Key aggregation and nonce aggregation are performed by party 2 in the case of blinding.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- The Ark protocol has been released as an alternative to the Lightning network.
- Ark uses virtual UTXOs and does not require opening and closing channels like Lightning.
- An untrusted intermediary called the Ark Service Provider enables anonymous off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The maximum block size and block time contribute to the storage growth of blockchain.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can last for 21 years without running out of space.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and affordable hardware make blockchain storage sufficient for practical usage.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard, a Lightning Network developer, proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The summit aims to leverage Africa's culture, financial systems, and growing Lightning developer community.
- Antoine invites objections, emphasizing transparency and plans to survey suitable countries for hosting the summit.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It introduces a new channel funding transaction and two new opcodes in Bitcoin.
- The proposal also discusses fraud proofs, saving bandwidth, and alternative options.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are conducting a "dry run" to validate reputation algorithms with real-world data.
- An experiment will include a TLV called "endorsement" in the `update_add_htlc` message.
- Node operators are encouraged to participate and prioritize privacy in data collection.
